Title: New models available
Body: We've just added 4 new models: DS1019+, DS2419+, DS1819+ and RS1619xs+

Title: New feature: share link to the source
Body: From now on you can use share link directly to source server page with parameters like model, version and even keyword.
The format is https://search.synopackge.com/ sources/[sourcename]/keyword/[k]/ model/[m]/version/[v]/channel/[c]
Where [k] keyword (could be *), [m] model (device), [v] version (with build numer, i.e. 6.2.1-23824), [c] channel (beta or stable). The order of parameters is important.

Title: Support for new device DS119j
Body: Today we add DS119j to the model list, so now it is possible to search for packages to this device.

However there are not many packages for this device at the moment, but the number will grow with time. We found only two sources that have packages compiled to DS119j (nimloth and emby). Other servers shows either noarch packages or shows packages that probably won't work on this device (cphub and synologyitalia). Let's hope synocommunity will serve their packages for this device soon!
More information available at the link below.
2018-11-16 EDIT: for DS119j packages from cphub & synologyitalia are valid as they are not specific to any architecture (noarch)
2018-11-30 EDIT: Good news! Synocommunity supports now armada37xx architecture, so there are new packages available for DS119j!
ExternalLinkDescription: Please add DS119J support: armada37xx architecture

Title: Synopackage ver. 2.0
Body: This is a new version of synopackage.com. The project was completly rewritten from PHP to .NET Core 2.1, Angular 6 and Typescript (whoever cares). Below you can find link to issues. Feel free to contribute!

The breaking change is that you need to provide your settings first (DSM version and model). If you don't do this the results will be shown for default version and model. Currently defaults are: 6.2.1 and DS218Play, but that may change in the future.
